com.google.api.client.http Documentation Differences

This file contains all the changes in documentation in the package com.google.api.client.http as colored differences. Deletions are shown like this, and additions are shown like this.
If no deletions or additions are shown in an entry, the HTML tags will be what has changed. The new HTML tags are shown in the differences. If no documentation existed, and then some was added in a later version, this change is noted in the appropriate class pages of differences, but the change is not shown on this page. Only changes in existing text are shown here. Similarly, documentation which was inherited from another class or interface is not shown here.
Note that an HTML error in the new documentation may cause the display of other documentation changes to be presented incorrectly. For instance, failure to close a <code> tag will cause all subsequent paragraphs to be displayed differently.
Class AbstractInputStreamContent

Serializes HTTP request content from an input stream into an output stream.

The .type field is required. Subclasses should implement the .getLength(), .getInputStream(), and .retrySupported() for their specific type of input stream. If you need to limit the amount of content read from the input stream, you may use LimitInputStream.

Implementations don't need to be thread-safe.

Warning:By in prior version 1.9 the maximum amountdefault, ofall content is read from the input stream. was limited by theIf instead you want .getLength(),to but now instead all content islimit the maximum amount of content read. from the input stream, Youyou may use use LimitInputStream if that functionality is needed.

@since 1.4 @author moshenko@google.com (Jacob Moshenko)
Class AbstractInputStreamContent, InputStream getInputStream()

Return an input stream for the specific implementation type of AbstractInputStreamContent. If the specific implementation will return {@code true} for .retrySupported() this should be a factory function which will create a new InputStream from the source data whenever invoked. Upgrade warning: in prior version 1.6 .getInputStream was protected, it is now public. @since 1.7
Class BackOffPolicy, long getNextBackOffMillis()

Gets the number of milliseconds to wait before retrying an HTTP request. If .STOP is returned, no retries should be made. This method should be used as follows: 
   long backoffTime = backoffPolicy.getNextBackoffMs();
   if (backoffTime == BackoffPolicy.STOP) {
     // Stop retrying.
   } else {
     // Retry after backoffTime.
   }
Upgrade warning: .getNextBackOffMillis now throws an IOException, it was not thrown prior to 1.9. @return the number of milliseconds to wait when backing off requests, or .STOP if no more retries should be made
Class BasicAuthentication

Basic authentication HTTP request initializer as specified in Basic Authentication Scheme

Implementation is immutable and thread-safe. It can be used as either an HTTP request initializer or an HTTP request execute interceptor. .initialize(HttpRequest) only sets itself as the interceptor. Authentication is actually done in .intercept(HttpRequest), which is implemented using HttpHeaders.setBasicAuthentication(String, String).

Warning: for backwards-compatibility .initialize also calls .intercept(HttpRequest), but this call will be removed in version 1.8. @since 1.7 @author Yaniv Inbar
Class ExponentialBackOffPolicy, long getNextBackOffMillis()

Gets the number of milliseconds to wait before retrying an HTTP request. If .STOP is returned, no retries should be made.

This method calculates the next back off interval using the formula: randomized_interval = retry_interval +/- (randomization_factor * retry_interval)

Subclasses may override if a different algorithm is required.

Upgrade warning: .getNextBackOffMillis now throws an IOException, it was not thrown prior to 1.9. @return the number of milliseconds to wait when backing off requests, or .STOP if no more retries should be made
Class HttpHeaders, Long getContentLength()

Returns the {@code "Content-Length"} header or {@code null} for none. Upgrade warning: in prior version content length was represented as a String, but now it is represented as a Long. @since 1.5
Class HttpHeaders, void serializeHeaders(HttpHeaders, StringBuilder, Logger, LowLevelHttpRequest)

Serializes headers to an @{link LowLevelHttpRequest}. @param headers HTTP headers @param logbuf log buffer or {@code null} for none @param logger logger or {@code null} for none. Logger must be specified if log buffer is specified @param lowLevelHttpRequest low level HTTP request where HTTP headers will be serialized to or {@code null} for none @since 1.99 @deprecated (scheduled to be removed in 1.12)

Sets the {@code "Content-Length"} header or {@code null} for none. Upgrade warning: in prior version content length was represented as a String, but now it is represented as a Long. @since 1.5
Class HttpMediaType

HTTP Media-type as specified in the HTTP RFC ( "http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2616.section-3.7").

Upgrade warning: Since version 1.11 parameter values are parsed less restrictively in order to conform with the multipart specification ( "http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc1341/7_2_Multipart.html"). Prior to version 1.11 parameter values were parsed according to the HTTP RFC.

Implementation is not thread-safe.

@author Matthias Linder (mlinder) @since 1.10
Class HttpParser

Parses HTTP response content into an data class of key/value pairs.

Implementations should normally be thread-safe.

@since 1.0 @author Yaniv Inbar @deprecated (scheduled to be removed in 1.1112) Use ObjectParser instead.
Class HttpRequest, void addParser(HttpParser)

Adds an HTTP response content parser.

If there is already a previous parser defined for this new parser (as defined by .getParser(String) then the previous parser will be removed.

Any parser set by calling .setParser(ObjectParser) will be preferred over this parser.

@since 1.4 @deprecated (scheduled to be removed in 1.1112) Use .setParser(ObjectParser) instead.
Class HttpRequest, int getContentLoggingLimit()

Returns the limit to the content size that will be logged during .execute().

If the content size is greater than this limit then it will not be logged.

Content will only be logged if .isLoggingEnabled is {@code true}.

Can be set to {@code 0} to disable content logging. This is useful for example if content has sensitive data such as authentication information.

Defaults to 16KB.

Upgrade warning: prior to version 1.9, the default was {@code 100,000} bytes, but now it is 16KB. @since 1.7
Class HttpRequest, HttpParser getParser(String)

Returns the HTTP response content parser to use for the given content type or {@code null} if none is defined. @param contentType content type or {@code null} for {@code null} result @return HTTP response content parser or {@code null} for {@code null} input @since 1.4 @deprecated (scheduled to be removed in 1.1112) Use .getParser() instead.
Class HttpRequest, boolean isAllowEmptyContent()

Some servers will fail to process a POST/PUT/PATCH unless Content-Length header >= 1. If this value is set to {@code false} then " " is set as the content with Content-Length {@code 1} for empty contents. Defaults to {@code true}. @since 1.77 @deprecated (scheduled to be removed in 1.12)
Class HttpRequest, String normalizeMediaType(String)

Returns the normalized media type without parameters of the form {@code type "/" subtype"} as specified in Media Types. @param mediaType unnormalized media type with possible parameters or {@code null} for {@code null} result @return normalized media type without parameters or {@code null} for {@code null} input @since 1.4 @deprecated (scheduled to be removed in 1.1112) Use HttpMediaType.equalsIgnoreParameters(HttpMediaType) instead
Class HttpRequest, HttpRequest setAllowEmptyContent(boolean)

Some servers will fail to process a POST/PUT/PATCH unless Content-Length header >= 1. If this value is set to {@code false} then " " is set as the content with Content-Length {@code 1} for empty contents. Defaults to {@code true}. @since 1.77 @deprecated (scheduled to be removed in 1.12) Use {@code setContent(new EmptyContent())}
Class HttpRequest, HttpRequest setContentLoggingLimit(int)

Set the limit to the content size that will be logged during .execute().

If the content size is greater than this limit then it will not be logged.

Content will only be logged if .isLoggingEnabled is {@code true}.

Can be set to {@code 0} to disable content logging. This is useful for example if content has sensitive data such as authentication information.

Defaults to 16KB.

Upgrade warning: prior to version 1.9, the default was {@code 100,000} bytes, but now it is 16KB. @since 1.7

Class HttpResponse, int getContentLoggingLimit()

Returns the limit to the content size that will be logged during .getContent().

Content will only be logged if .isLoggingEnabled is {@code true}.

If the content size is greater than this limit then it will not be logged.

Can be set to {@code 0} to disable content logging. This is useful for example if content has sensitive data such as authentication information.

Defaults to HttpRequest.getContentLoggingLimit().

Upgrade warning: prior to version 1.9, the default was {@code 100,000} bytes, but now it is HttpRequest.getContentLoggingLimit(). @since 1.7
Class HttpResponse, HttpParser getParser()

Returns the HTTP response content parser to use for the content type of this HTTP response or {@code null} for none. @deprecated (scheduled to be removed in 1.1112) Use .getRequest(). HttpRequest.getParser() instead
Class HttpResponse, T parseAs(Class<T>)

Parses the content of the HTTP response from .getContent() and reads it into a data class of key/value pairs using the parser returned by .getParser().

Upgrade Warning: Prior to version 1.11 this method would throw an IllegalArgumentException when no Content-Type is present in the response and the deprecated HttpParsers were used. Since 1.11 this method will return {@code null} as documented when the server responds with a status code indicating that there is no content, or when a HEAD request was made to the server.

Reference: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2616#section-4.3

@return parsed data class or {@code null} for no content @throws IOException I/O exception @throws IllegalArgumentException if no parser is defined for the given content type or if there is no content type defined in the HTTP response
Class HttpResponse, String parseAsString()

Parses the content of the HTTP response from .getContent() and reads it into a string.

Since this method returns {@code ""} for no content, a simpler check for no content is to check if .getContent() is {@code null}.

Warning:All in prior versioncontent is read 1.9from the maximum amount ofinput content parsed forstream un-GZippedrather content was setthan being limited by thethe Content-Length header, but now instead all content is read. Also, prior version For assumed the charset was {@codecharacter "UTF-8"}set, but now it follows the specification by parsing the the "charset" parameter of the Content-Type header or by default {@code "ISO-8859-1"} if the parameter is missing.

@return parsed string or {@code ""} for no content @throws IOException I/O exception
Class HttpResponse, HttpResponse setContentLoggingLimit(int)

Set the limit to the content size that will be logged during .getContent().

Content will only be logged if .isLoggingEnabled is {@code true}.

If the content size is greater than this limit then it will not be logged.

Can be set to {@code 0} to disable content logging. This is useful for example if content has sensitive data such as authentication information.

Defaults to HttpRequest.getContentLoggingLimit().

Upgrade warning: prior to version 1.9, the default was {@code 100,000} bytes, but now it is HttpRequest.getContentLoggingLimit(). @since 1.7
Class HttpResponseException, int getStatusCode()

Returns the HTTP status code or {@code 0} for none. Upgrade warning: Overriding this method is no longer supported, and will be made final in 1.10. @since 1.7
Class HttpResponseException, boolean isSuccessStatusCode()

Returns whether received a successful HTTP status code {@code >= 200 && <300} (see .getStatusCode()). Upgrade warning: Overriding this method is no longer supported, and will be made final in 1.10. @since 1.7
Class LowLevelHttpRequest, void addHeader(String, String)

Adds a header to the HTTP request.

Note that multiple headers of the same name need to be supported, in which case .addHeader will be called for each instance of the header.

Warning: in prior version 1.9 there was no IOException declared as thrown, but in version 1.10 an IOException may be thrown. @param name header name @param value header value
Class LowLevelHttpRequest, void setContent(HttpContent)

Sets the HTTP request content. @throws IOException I/O exception
Class UrlEncodedContent, constructor UrlEncodedContent(Object)

Upgrade warning: prior to version 1.7,11 the {@code data} parameter could be {@code null} but now {@code null} is not allowed and instead a new instance of an implementation of Map will be created. In versionit 1.8throws a NullPointerException will be thrown instead.

@param data key name/value data
Class UrlEncodedContent, Object getData()

Returns the key name/value data or {@code null} for none. Upgrade warning: prior to version 1.7 this could return {@code null} but now it always returns a {@code non-null} value. Also overriding this method is no longer supported, and will be made final in 1.8. @since 1.5
Class UrlEncodedContent, UrlEncodedContent setData(Object)

Sets the key name/value data.

Overriding is only supported for the purpose of calling the super implementation and changing the return type, but nothing else.

Upgrade warning: prior to version 1.7,11 the {@code data} parameter could be {@code null} but now {@code null} is not allowed and instead a new instance of an implementation of Map will be created.it Inthrows version 1.8 a NullPointerException will be thrown instead.

@since 1.5
